decks.notes: This Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Fleecemane Lion, Courser of Kruphix, and Siege Rhino to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion provides additional value and threat diversity. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Den Protector offer versatility and card advantage, allowing the deck to adapt to various matchups and strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures, removal, and planeswalker threats.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early on with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Seeker of the Way, supported by removal spells like Crackling Doom and Draconic Roar to control the board. It also includes dragons like Stormbreath Dragon and Thunderbreak Regent to deal large amounts of damage and close out the game quickly. The deck is designed to maintain a fast pace of play and constantly threaten the opponent's life total, making it difficult for them to stabilize and turn the game in their favor.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with efficient mana costs, backed up by a variety of removal spells and combat tricks. The key strategy is to apply early pressure with cards like Fleecemane Lion and Rakshasa Deathdealer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall. The deck also has a strong mid-to-late game presence with powerful threats like Siege Rhino and Wingmate Roc. The mana base is designed to support the three-color Abzan strategy, allowing for consistent access to all the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing control of the board with aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Deathmist Raptor, supported by mana acceleration from creatures like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid. The deck utilizes powerful spells such as Mastery of the Unseen and Dromoka's Command to further solidify board presence and protect its creatures. Dragonlord Ojutai and Surrak, the Hunt Caller provide additional threats and value. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with consistent pressure and efficient use of resources to secure a strong advantage in the early game.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain a strong aggressive strategy with a focus on creature efficiency and disruption. By using a combination of powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Fleecemane Lion, along with key removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure to the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Den Protector allows for additional versatility and flexibility in adapting to different situations during the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. It aims to control the board early on with cards like Thoughtseize, Bile Blight, and Hero's Downfall while applying pressure with creatures like Siege Rhino, Deathmist Raptor, and Fleecemane Lion. The deck also features cards that provide value and resilience such as Den Protector and Courser of Kruphix. Elspeth, Sun's Champion serves as a powerful finisher. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color combination of white, black, and green.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures to put pressure on the opponent, utilizing efficiency and versatility. It also includes cards that can generate extra value or protect your creatures from removal. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy by providing the necessary colors for its spells. By establishing a board presence early and maintaining pressure with evasive threats, this deck aims to swiftly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mix of efficient creatures and powerful combat tricks. It utilizes cards like Collected Company to quickly fill the board with threats, while also having access to Valorous Stance and Dromoka's Command to protect its creatures and disrupt opponents. The mana base is designed for consistency and to support the aggressive game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain that pressure throughout the game to out-tempo and overwhelm the opponent.

The key concept of the Abzan Aggro deck is to maintain a fast, aggressive pace in order to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a combination of powerful creatures such as Siege Rhino, Anafenza, the Foremost, and Fleecemane Lion, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Abzan Charm to control the board. The deck also features versatile cards like Dromoka's Command and Hero's Downfall for added flexibility. With a strong mana base and a focus on high-impact creatures, the Abzan Aggro deck aims to quickly establish dominance and pressure the opponent.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, utilizing powerful creatures like Siege Rhino, Rakshasa Deathdealer, and Fleecemane Lion to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command provide versatility and flexibility in dealing with threats. The mana base is designed to support the different colored spells in the deck, allowing for consistent and smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to put constant pressure on the opponent and maintain board control to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while also having access to powerful control elements through cards like Disdainful Stroke, Dromoka's Command, and Valorous Stance. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on with cards like Fleecemane Lion and Elvish Mystic, while also having resilient threats like Den Protector and Deathmist Raptor. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure the deck has access to all necessary colors for its spells, while also providing flexibility and consistency in its gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful dragon creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counters like Silumgar's Scorn and removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Bile Blight. The deck also has powerful card advantage engines like Dig Through Time and Dragonlord's Prerogative to help stay ahead in resources. The powerful dragon creatures like Dragonlord Silumgar and Silumgar, the Drifting Death provide a strong win condition to close out the game once the opponent's threats have been dealt with.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to stall the game until it can use powerful dragons, like Dragonlord Ojutai and Dragonlord Silumgar, to dominate the battlefield and secure victory. By utilizing a mix of card draw, removal, and control spells, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain a strong board presence to control the pace of the game and ultimately come out on top.

The deck is focused on dealing quick and consistent damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. It also utilizes cards that pump up creatures and provide extra damage, allowing for a fast and aggressive playstyle. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent early in the game with a flurry of creatures and direct damage spells, putting pressure on them to respond or risk losing quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful dragons and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents. It includes various mana ramp cards to quickly play high-cost dragons like Dragonlord Atarka and Stormbreath Dragon. Draconic Roar and Crater's Claws provide removal and burn options, while cards like Xenagos, the Reveler and Courser of Kruphix help generate additional mana and card advantage. The deck aims to establish board presence early and apply pressure with flying, hasty creatures to secure a swift victory.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's plans and removing threats from the board. With a mixture of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Ashiok and Ugin, you aim to outlast your opponent and win through attrition. By efficiently using your resources to answer threats and draw into more answers, you aim to establish control over the game and dictate the pace of play. The deck utilizes a combination of permission spells, board wipes, and card advantage to grind out a victory against a variety of opponents.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall. The deck looks to apply pressure with efficient threats like Siege Rhino, Fleecemane Lion, and Anafenza, the Foremost, while also providing resilience and card advantage with cards like Den Protector and Whisperwood Elemental. The deck also includes removal spells like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command to deal with opposing threats. The overall strategy is to curve out with powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan to close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Siege Rhino, backed up by disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Abzan Charm. The recursion engine of Den Protector and Deathmist Raptor provides long-term value and resilience. Elspeth, Sun's Champion serves as a finisher and a way to go wide against control decks. The mana base enables consistent access to all three colors while also minimizing damage from pain lands. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure from the start and maintain it throughout the game to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this Abzan Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Courser of Kruphix, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize. The deck aims to maintain board advantage with cards like Siege Rhino and Den Protector, and finish the game with powerful spells like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Wingmate Roc. The deck also includes removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm to deal with threats from the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and aggression to control the game.

The main idea of this Bant Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly by playing aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion, Elvish Mystic, Den Protector, and Deathmist Raptor. These creatures are supported by powerful cards like Mastery of the Unseen and Valorous Stance to maintain board control and protect them from removal. The deck also includes counterspells like Disdainful Stroke and Dromoka's Command for disruption. With a mix of ramp, card advantage, and resilient threats, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game efficiently.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly build a strong board presence using low-cost creatures like Satyr Hoplite and Favored Hoplite, while also utilizing combat tricks and protection spells to push damage through and protect your creatures. Cards like Titan's Strength and Temur Battle Rage can give your creatures a power boost for a lethal attack, while Gods Willing and Ajani's Presence can protect them from removal spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient combat interactions.
